Israel on Saturday said a female civilian hostage named Arbel Yehoud was supposed to be released, while Hamas has held Israel responsible for delaying the planned return of hundreds of thousands of displaced Palestinians to northern Gaza.

385.summary: Hundreds of the world's most powerful people — among them every living president as well as billionaire tech executives — were crammed cheek-by-jowl in the 7,200-square-foot Capitol Rotunda.
385.author: Seema Mehta

386.title: Disappointment at border as Trump cancels immigration program
386.summary: The Trump administration cancelled a program aimed at easing the process of applying for asylum, leaving thousands of asylum-seekers disappointed and unsure of what to do next.
386.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

387.title: It's below freezing in D.C., but Trump supporters are thrilled to be present
387.summary: Most people who traveled to Washington to watch the event in person have been relegated to the Capital One Arena, a sports venue nearby, for a livestream of the official ceremony.
387.author: Faith E. Pinho, Seema Mehta, Hailey Branson-Potts

388.title: Opinion: It's time to relearn the lessons of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense'
388.summary: The revolutionary rallying cry 'Common Sense' — challenging authoritarian rule, countering the sway of the wealthy and upholding the will of the majority — is as relevant in 2025 as it was in 1776.
388.author: A.T. McWilliams

389.title: Trump is sworn in as the nation's 47th president, capping historic comeback
389.summary: Donald Trump took the oath of office to become the 47th president in a historic Inauguration Day.
389.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho, James Rainey, Hailey Branson-Potts

390.title: RFK Jr. wants to improve Americans' health. Here's some advice from the outgoing FDA chief
390.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has big plans for the FDA if he's confirmed as Secretary of Health and Human Services. FDA Commissioner Robert Califf explains why certain changes may not be that easy — or desirable.
390.author: Karen Kaplan

391.title: Cease-fire between Israel and Hamas begins with hostages being handed over
391.summary: Three hostages were handed over to Israeli forces — the first of 33 expected to be freed over the next six weeks in exchange for some 1,900 Palestinians. The deal follows months of negotiations.
391.author: Nabih Bulos, Bilal Shbair

392.title: News Analysis: Once again, the world sizes up a Trump presidency
392.summary: As Donald Trump takes the oath of office again, the world watches with a sense that, this time, those outside the U.S. have a better idea what to expect.
392.author: Laura King, Tracy Wilkinson

393.title: Opinion: If Martin Luther King Jr. were alive, how would he have approached the Trump era?
393.summary: The president-elect's inauguration takes place on the holiday honoring the civil rights leader, prompting us to consider how King might respond to Trump's America.
393.author: Earl Ofari Hutchinson

394.title: Opinion: Experts once thought highly of Biden's presidency. Here's how his legacy is likely to change
394.summary: A year ago, a survey of presidential scholars put him in the top third of chief executives while Trump ranked last. But that was before the 2024 election and campaign.
394.author: Brandon Rottinghaus and Justin Vaughn

395.title: Trump's first inaugural speech was 'American carnage.' He says this time will be different
395.summary: Will Trump take the opportunity this time, in his second inaugural speech, to talk of unity? Or will it be more 'American carnage'?
395.author: Doyle McManus

396.title: Column: Why's it so hard to do the right thing and honor the true heroes of Jan. 6?
396.summary: Nearly three years after passage of legislation to place a commemorative plaque on the western front of the Capitol there is still no action. Speaker Mike Johnson and other Trump allies are trying to bury history.
396.author: Mark Z. Barabak

397.title: Calmes: Biden delivered a new 'Roaring '20s.' Watch Trump try to take the credit
397.summary: No matter what the new president says, the facts show that Joe Biden left America in better economic shape than he found it.
397.author: Jackie Calmes

398.title: Supporters of South Korea's Yoon storm courthouse. Some see hope in Trump's return
398.summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's supporters storm the courthouse that issued a warrant extending his detention, climbing walls and smashing windows.
398.author: Max Kim

399.title: Trump expected to survey Los Angeles-area wildfire damage this week
399.summary: President-elect Donald Trump, in perhaps his first official trip after being inaugurated Monday, will likely visit the Los Angeles area to survey wildfire damage late next week.
399.author: Seema Mehta

400.title: Supreme Court will decide if parents may reject LGBTQ+ lessons for their kids
400.summary: Supreme Court will take up a dispute over grade school textbooks that include LGBTQ+ themes, pitting religious rights against individual rights.
400.author: David G. Savage

401.title: Brad Pitt's team reminds fans he's not on social media after a woman gets big-time scammed
401.summary: Brad Pitt is not on social media, his team reminded fans, after a French woman said she was conned out of $800,000 by scammers posing as the A-list actor.
401.author: Nardine Saad

402.title: Supreme Court upholds law that could force TikTok to shut down in U.S.
402.summary: Congress and now the Supreme Court say TikTok must separate itself from its Chinese owners or shut down operations in the U.S.
402.author: David G. Savage

403.title: Joan Plowright, award-winning 'Enchanted April' and 'Stalin' actor, dies at 95
403.summary: Joan Plowright, the celebrated English actor whose career included the films 'Enchanted April,' 'The Entertainer' and 'Spiderwick Chronicles,' has died at 95.
403.author: Alexandra Del Rosario

404.title: Opinion: What a century-old disaster can teach fire-ravaged L.A. about recovery and rebuilding
404.summary: Some in the fire-ravaged city have taken to laying personal blame. But what endures from the Canadian disaster is the generosity of those who helped rebuild.
404.author: Ben Proudfoot

405.title: Migration across the U.S.-Mexico border, in 5 charts
405.summary: Arrivals at the border are the lowest they've been since incoming President Trump first left office in 2021.
405.author: Andrea Castillo, Koko Nakajima

406.title: Trump made many 'Day 1' promises. Will he make good on them?
406.summary: President-elect Donald Trump could start taking action Monday on his many "Day 1" campaign promises, but California officials and others are ready to fight.
406.author: Kevin Rector

407.title: Bitter feud among Sinaloa cartel families brings grim new tactic: Grave desecration
407.summary: In the escalating war among rival factions of Mexico's Sinaloa cartel, sons of Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán are suspected of ordering the destruction of elaborate mausoleums that belong to rival families, including one for a fallen grandson of Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada.
407.author: Keegan Hamilton

408.title: Fire lessons from the Australian capital, where a 2003 inferno changed everything
408.summary: Two decades ago, fire ripped through Canberra, destroying 480 homes. An Australian fire chief reflects on possible lessons for California.
408.author: Max Kim

409.title: Padilla hopes to increase firefighter pay, create affordable housing for disaster response
409.summary: California Sen. Alex Padilla introduced several bills to increase firefighter pay, expand FEMA funding and include affordable housing as part of disaster response.
409.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho

410.title: Harris joins a decades-old tradition for vice presidents in her final days in office
410.summary: Vice President Kamala Harris, in one of her last public appearances in the role, signed her ceremonial desk drawer at the White House on Thursday, a tradition that dates back nearly a century.
410.author: Seema Mehta

411.title: Rep. Nancy Pelosi will not attend Trump's inauguration
411.summary: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-San Francisco) will not attend the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump.
411.author: Kevin Rector

412.title: Calmes: The case of the missing Hegseth investigation
412.summary: Trump's unfit nominee for Defense secretary gets the benefit of an incomplete, half-baked and secret FBI report.
412.author: Jackie Calmes

413.title: What will Mexico do if Trump tries to mass deport non-Mexicans across the border?
413.summary: How will Mexican leaders respond if, as expected, Trump pressures them to accept deportees from third countries? 'Mexico is in a really tough spot.'
413.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

414.title: Supreme Court leans in favor of state-enforced age limits on porn websites
414.summary: Can Texas and other red states limit children from instant access to vast amounts of online pornography? The Supreme Court will decide.
414.author: David G. Savage

415.title: Neil Gaiman denies sexual assault allegations: 'I don't accept there was any abuse'
415.summary: Neil Gaiman, the bestselling fantasy author, denies sexual abuse allegations made by eight women in an explosive New York Magazine article.
415.author: Nardine Saad

416.title: The FDA knew long ago that red dye No. 3 causes cancer. Why did it take so long to ban it?
416.summary: The FDA banned the use of red dye No. 3 in foods and medicines sold in the U.S. because it has been shown to cause cancer in rats. The action highlights the limits of a federal law known as the Delaney clause.
416.author: Karen Kaplan

417.title: Sen. Marco Rubio appears set to win confirmation as secretary of State
417.summary: Rubio and Trump have put aside past acrimony to make the Florida lawmaker the least controversial in an unusual slate of Cabinet picks.
417.author: Tracy Wilkinson

418.title: Cease-fire deal reached between Israel and Hamas in Gaza
418.summary: A cease-fire deal, announced by U.S. and Qatari mediators, promises to end more than a year of conflict in Gaza Strip. Some Israeli hostages would be exchanged for Palestinian prisoners under the agreement.
418.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King, Nabih Bulos

419.title: Trump's tariffs brought China and Mexico closer. Will his second term change that?
419.summary: China has strengthened trade with Latin America at the expense of the U.S. But Donald Trump, who threatens to raise tariffs on Mexico, could upend those ties.
419.author: Stephanie Yang

420.title: Biden administration to lift 'terrorism' designation on Cuba
420.summary: In its waning days, the first Trump administration put Cuba on terrorism list. Biden is removing it.
420.author: Tracy Wilkinson

421.title: 'TikTok refugees' unexpectedly turn to Chinese alternative as ban looms
421.summary: A number of TikTok users appear to be turning to an app called RedNote — more commonly known to its majority-Chinese audience by its Chinese name, Xiaohongshu.
421.author: Stephanie Yang, Xin-yun Wu

422.title: The Senate is considering the Laken Riley Act. Here's what it would do
422.summary: The bill would require immigration officers to detain immigrants who are suspected of minor theft and cede some federal immigration enforcement power to states.
422.author: Andrea Castillo

423.title: Kate Middleton's cancer is now in remission: 'It takes time to adjust to a new normal'
423.summary: Catherine, Princess of Wales, confirmed Tuesday that her cancer is in remission during a visit with the staff and patients of the Royal Marsden in Chelsea.
423.author: Nardine Saad

424.title: Special counsel report says Trump would've been convicted for 'unprecedented criminal effort' in Jan. 6 case
424.summary: The report, arriving just days before Trump is to return to office, focuses fresh attention on his failed effort to cling to power after his election loss in 2020.
424.author: Alanna Durkin Richer, Eric Tucker and Colleen Long

425.title: Supreme Court denies oil industry plea to block climate lawsuits filed by California, other blue states
425.summary: Supreme Court will not block California's suit against big oil companies for damage from climate change.
425.author: David G. Savage

426.title: Column: Trump wants to grab control of Greenland, Canada and the Panama Canal. He's already bungled it
426.summary: Trump wants to take Greenland from Denmark, make Canada the 51st state and retake the Panama Canal, threats reflecting his view that might makes right.
426.author: Doyle McManus

427.title: Newsom suspends landmark environmental laws to ease rebuilding in wildfire zones
427.summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom on Sunday signed an executive order suspending parts of the Coastal Act and the California Environmental Quality Act to aid homeowners rebuilding after losses in last week's wildfires.
427.author: Seema Mehta, Liam Dillon, Rosanna Xia

428.title: Calmes: Merrick Garland's integrity saved the DOJ only to doom it again
428.summary: Atty. Gen. Merrick Garland's uprightness rescued the Department of Justice from Donald Trump's grip. But then he handed it over again.
428.author: Jackie Calmes

429.title: 'This is your Hurricane Katrina': Assessing the long road ahead for L.A.
429.summary: Craig Fugate, who led the Federal Emergency Management Agency in the Obama administration, has seen a lot of natural disasters.
429.author: Kevin Rector

430.title: Opinion: Why Israel can't just 'cut the head off' of Hamas or Hezbollah
430.summary: These groups are organic and homegrown, unlike the Islamic State or Al Qaeda, which have relied heavily on fighters from abroad. Hamas and Hezbollah will replenish their ranks with locals.
430.author: Colin P. Clarke

431.title: Column: 'Are you OK?' Thank you for asking about us in fire-ravaged L.A.
431.summary: If you live in Southern California, you're getting the messages via text, email, IMs, chats and every other way imaginable: People worldwide asking if you are safe.
431.author: Lorraine Ali

432.title: 'They just got my uncle': Immigration arrests spark fear among farmworkers in Central Valley
432.summary: Dozens have been arrested in the heavily agricultural Kern County during a multiple-day operation by U.S. Customs and Border Protection.
432.author: Rachel Uranga, Andrea Castillo

433.title: 2024 was the hottest year on record, NASA and NOAA confirm
433.summary: Weather organizations from around the world agree that the planet's average global surface temperature in 2024 could well have passed a crucial threshold meant to limit the worst effects of climate change.
433.author: Corinne Purtill, Karen Kaplan

434.title: Supreme Court casts doubt on TikTok's free-speech defense as shutdown law is set to take effect
434.summary: Supreme Court is not likely to save TikTok from a U.S. shutdown, but incoming President Trump may try.
434.author: David G. Savage, Andrea Chang

435.title: South Korea's far right borrows from Trump's playbook to bolster impeached Yoon
435.summary: The president's conservative supporters contend that the country has been overrun by North Korea sympathizers conspiring to destroy South Korea's freedoms.
435.author: Max Kim

436.title: Alec Baldwin sues New Mexico, claiming malicious prosecution
436.summary: Six months after being cleared of criminal charges in the "Rust" shooting death, actor Alec Baldwin has filed a suit alleging malicious prosecution and defamation by New Mexico prosecutors and law enforcement.
436.author: Meg James

437.title: Supreme Court turns down Trump plea to block New York sentencing for hush money conviction
437.summary: Trump and his lawyers saw Supreme Court as a friendly forum, but it turned down his request.
437.author: David G. Savage

438.title: News Analysis: Carter, during and after presidency, changed way world saw the U.S. — often for the better
438.summary: He brought human rights to forefront in foreign policy, laid security foundations that have endured.
438.author: Tracy Wilkinson

439.title: Calmes: Jimmy Carter, Joe Biden and revisionist presidential history
439.summary: Even Republicans, who have used President Carter to attack Democrats for nearly 50 years, have had to reckon with revisionism.
439.author: Jackie Calmes

440.title: Jimmy Carter and the sad saga of a 9-ton Northern California peanut
440.summary: Former President Jimmy Carter once was offered a gift from Northern California: a 9-ton peanut carved from a redwood tree. His aides said no thanks.
440.author: Hailey Branson-Potts

441.title: Biden celebrates birth of great-grandchild after briefing on L.A. wildfires
441.summary: President Biden announced that he became a great-grandfather on Wednesday after his granddaughter Naomi gave birth in Los Angeles.
441.author: Liam Dillon

442.title: A long, freezing wait for a few hushed moments: A people's farewell to Jimmy Carter
442.summary: What people thought about at the public viewing of Jimmy Carter lying in state in the Capitol: reflections on a long and well-lived life, anxiety over what lies ahead.
442.author: Laura King

443.title: What's in a name? Gulf of America? Mexican America?
443.summary: Mexico's president pokes fun at Trump's suggestion to change the name of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America.
443.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

444.title: Barbara Lee announces bid for Oakland mayor as city looks to rise from crisis
444.summary: Former U.S. Rep. Barbara Lee, who represented the East Bay in Congress for over two decades, announced plans to run for mayor of Oakland in a special election.
444.author: Hannah Wiley

445.title: It was once the capital of Iran's 'axis of resistance.' Now a Syrian town grapples with its future
445.summary: The Syrian shrine of Sayeda Zainab drew Iran-backed militiamen from throughout the region. With Assad's fall, they've fled, raising questions about the future of the area — and of the axis.
445.author: Nabih Bulos

446.title: Trump asks Supreme Court to block his sentencing in New York criminal case
446.summary: Trump urges Supreme Court to intervene to stop his sentencing in New York for his hush money conviction.
446.author: David G. Savage

447.title: Bracing for Trump, Mexico aims to roll out a 'panic app' for Mexican nationals being deported
447.summary: Bracing for Trump and his threatened migrant roundups, Mexico aims to roll out a 'panic app' for Mexican nationals facing deportation from the United States.
447.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

448.title: Opinion: The limits of an imperial presidency
448.summary: Executive actions by presidents have to be grounded in defensible legal authority and process. Just because Donald Trump says he can do something doesn't mean he can.
448.author: Stephen A. Myrow

449.title: 'All hell will break out': 3 foreign policy takeaways from Trump
449.summary: Trump promised 'all hell will break out' in the Middle East if Israeli hostages are not returned by the time he takes office.
449.author: Faith E. Pinho, Patrick J. McDonnell, Tracy Wilkinson

450.title: Opinion: Trump wants to rekindle his Kim Jong Un bromance, but North Korea has other suitors now
450.summary: Trump's personal diplomacy couldn't solve the North Korean nuclear conundrum first time around. What are his chances now?
450.author: Daniel R. DePetris

451.title: Opinion: What antiabortion activists want next
451.summary: The Supreme Court said states should decide access to abortion, but activists are mounting lawsuits and lobbying Washington for what could amount to a national ban.
451.author: Mary Ziegler

452.title: Strong earthquake in China kills scores of people in Tibet
452.summary: The USGS measured the quake at 7.1. Dozens of aftershocks shook the region of western China and across the border in Nepal.
452.author: Ken Moritsugu

453.title: Paco Ignacio Taibo II: A book-reading advocate in the era of TikTok
453.summary: The acclaimed novelist and historian runs Mexican government publishing house El Fondo de Cultura Económica.
453.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

454.title: Opinion: The election shredded the rule of law
454.summary: Judge Juan M. Merchan has few alternatives but to hand President-elect Donald Trump a get-out-of-jail-free card.
454.author: Erwin Chemerinsky

455.title: Harris presides as Congress certifies Trump's victory, marking a very different Jan. 6
455.summary: Four years after Donald Trump supporters stormed the Capitol, Vice President Kamala Harris formally certified his win in the 2024 election.
455.author: Faith E. Pinho

456.title: Trump on Mount Rushmore? MAGA supporters push for his face on iconic monument
456.summary: Following Donald Trump's recent political gains, supporters propose adding his face to Mount Rushmore. This idea was pushed by his ex-aide Corey Lewandowski and quickly backed on social media. Representative Anna Paulina Luna is now preparing the necessary documentation to move forward with the proposal.
456.author: TOI World Desk

457.title: Bill Gates admits he regrets divorcing Melinda the most: 'It was miserable for me...'
457.summary: ​Bill and Melinda were married in 1994 and have three kids Jennifer, 28, Rory, 25 and Phoebe, 22. They announced their split in May 2021 and said that they had been living separately for a year. Bill earlier admitted that he caused pain when she confronted him about a report that he'd had an affair with a Microsoft employee.
457.author: TOI World Desk

458.title: Kamala Harris never had a backup plan for losing the election, says insider. 'Even until 6,7 pm on election night...'
458.summary: ​Kamala Harris established an LLC called Pioneer 49 last month in California, according to her presidential campaign's financial disclosure. The disclosure describes the company as an "entity to assist the former vice president," Politico reported. ​Pioneer is Harris' code name used by the Secret Service. And she was the 49th vice president. Barack Obama too used his code name Renegade to create the organisation Renegade 44 when he left office.
458.author: TOI World Desk

459.title: 'Haven't had assassination in yrs': Man held for threatening messages against Trump
459.summary: A 46-year-old Florida man, Shannon Depararro Atkins, was arrested for making threats against President Trump on social media. He was found with cocaine during a traffic stop and faces drug possession and second-degree felony charges for threatening to kill, cause harm, or execute a terrorist act. He acknowledged creating the threatening posts and is currently detained.
459.author: TOI World Desk

460.title: Chinese nationals file petition against harassment by Pakistani police
460.summary: The Sindh High Court has issued notices to several authorities following a petition by Chinese citizens alleging police harassment, extortion, and movement restrictions in Sindh province. The petitioners claim that their legal investments and residence in Pakistan are being compromised due to unjustified detentions, bribes, and unprofessional conduct by police officials.
460.author: Omer Farooq Khan

461.title: Elon Musk's mother uses three words to describe Usha Vance amid racist attacks
461.summary: Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk reacted to a social media post that questioned why Vice President JD Vance's wife, Second Lady Usha Vance was not being celebrated while she became the first Indian-American and the first Hindu to serve as the Second Lady of the United States. "Usha is even lovelier in person, smart and charming," Maye Musk said.
461.author: TOI World Desk

462.title: Unidentified drones return over New Jersey and New York after FAA lifts ban
462.summary: Large drones have resumed flights over New Jersey and New York, with more than 100 sightings reported in the past three weeks. Enigma Labs documented 22,000 sightings in 2024, primarily in the Northeast. New Jersey remains a hotspot, with most reports describing hovering objects. Enigma's data shows a notable increase in sightings after FAA restrictions were lifted.
462.author: TOI World Desk

463.title: Barron Trump: The 'Last US President'? 19th-century novels revive bizarre theories
463.author: TOI World Desk

464.title: Donald Trump fires at least dozen internal government watchdogs: Report
464.summary: President Trump dismissed at least twelve federal agencies' inspectors general, tasked with identifying and preventing government fraud and abuse, shortly after beginning his second term. Massachusetts Senator Elizabeth Warren criticized the move, saying it dismantles checks on Trump's power and encourages corruption.
464.author: TOI World Desk

465.title: Pete Hegseth's seven children present as he takes oath as defense secretary. Video viral
465.summary: Pete Hegseth has been married thrice and is the father of four biological children and three step-children. Hegseth, the new defense secretary, has one child with his present wife Jennifer Rauchet, three children with his second wife Samantha Deering. He is also the stepdad to Rauchet's three children from her previous marriage. Hegseth's first wife was Meredith Schwarz.
465.author: TOI World Desk

466.title: Donald Trump reacts to Mitch McConnell voting against Pete Heseth: 'Winning is what matters, right?'
466.summary: McConnel issued a lengthy statement against Hegseth as he said that whoever leads the Pentagon faces a "daily test with staggering consequences for the security of the American people and our global interests." "Mr Hegseth has failed, as yet, to demonstrate that he will pass this test. But as he assumes office, the consequences of failure are as high as they have ever been,” he said.
466.author: TOI World Desk

467.title: Chicago elementary school mistakes secret service for ICE agents
467.summary: Federal agents mistaken for ICE officers were denied entry at a Chicago elementary school during an investigation on Friday. The agents were actually Secret Service agents investigating a threat to a protectee. School officials closely followed protocols to ensure student safety amid concerns about immigration enforcement.
467.author: TOI World Desk

468.title: ‘Unlawfully terrorized’: New Jersey Mayor after federal agents conducts raid amid immigration crackdown
468.summary: Immigration officials in Newark, NJ detained both undocumented migrants and American citizens, including a military veteran, during a workplace sweep. Mayor Ras Baraka condemned the operation for constitutional rights violations and ICE is investigating the incident. The enforcement action aligns with President Trump's new directives.
468.author: TOI World Desk

469.title: 'Sociopath': Elon Musk's biographer slams his Auschwitz visit
469.summary: Elon Musk's January 2024 visit to Auschwitz drew criticism, with observers calling it a publicity stunt. Holocaust survivor's partner described Musk as detached and unmoved. Allegations of antisemitism persist after his controversial gesture and subsequent Nazi-related jokes, despite his attempts to counter claims.
469.author: TOI World Desk

470.title: What happened during Donald Trump's 45-minute phone call with Denmark's PM? 'It was a cold shower'
470.summary: President Donald Trump had a tense 45-minute phone call with Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen, during which he expressed strong intent to purchase Greenland. Denmark officials reportedly described the conversation as firm, with Trump threatening specific measures like tariffs. Greenland's PM Mute Egede stated emphatically that Greenlanders will decide their future, asserting independence from the US and Denmark.
470.author: TOI World Desk

471.title: Trump’s bold first week: A look at early moves of his second term
471.author: TOI World Desk

472.title: What JD Vance said after voting tie-breaker for Pete Hegseth; Elon Musk reacts
472.summary: ​"I thought I was done voting in the senate," JD Vance wrote as he had to do a senator's job for Hegseth again. Elon Musk reacted to JD Vance's statement with a 'tears of joy' smiley. JD Vance is no longer a senator as he resigned from the Ohio senator post after becoming the vice president but had to cast the vote to break the tie.
472.author: TOI World Desk

473.title: Jason Whitlock says Barack Obama and Michelle have no reason to stay married after Biden did this
473.summary: Jason Whitlock made an explosive claim about Barack Obama and Michelle Obama's marriage that it was never out of love but had a political reason behind it. Barack Obama needed a Black wife to be the president and after Biden made it impossible for Michelle Obama to run for president this year, Barack and Michell have no reason to stay married to each other, the commentator said.
473.author: TOI World Desk

474.title: 3 South African soldiers killed, 18 injured in DR Congo: Sources
474.summary: Three South African soldiers were killed and 18 injured in clashes with M23 forces in the eastern DRC. The South African troops were part of a mission by the Southern African Development Community, but there has been concern over the lack of communication from the military regarding the situation.

475.title: Trump's team says Mark Zuckerberg has more 'a**-kissing' to do: 'It's a good start but not nearly enough'
475.summary: ​The members of the Trump team don't quite buy Zuckerberg's right-wing conversion as entirely genuine and think that it is at least partly motivated by self-interest. They have even spoken to Trump about Zuckerberg's desperate attempts to enter Trump's inner orbit, a Rolling Stone report said. A Trump team member said Zuckerberg needs to do more to be given entry to the inner orbit.
475.author: TOI World Desk

476.title: ‘Future of Europe’ hangs on German snap elections – Musk
476.summary:
Elon Musk has urged Germans to support for the AfD party ahead of the snap vote that he believes could decide the fate of the world
Read Full Article at RT.com

Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto has lashed out at Donald Tusk after the Polish premier threatened Budapest with “consequences”
Read Full Article at RT.com

The EU should station troops in Greenland, the EU military chief has said, citing its “geopolitical” importance and Brussels’ interests

Donald Tusk has warned that Viktor Orban will be punished for “playing in Putin’s team”
Read Full Article at RT.com

Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico has proposed enshrining the recognition of only two genders in the constitution
Read Full Article at RT.com

Moscow will respond appropriately to any moves by the US-led bloc in the region, Aleksandr Grushko has said

Some 200 captives have been traded for four Israeli hostages as part of a ceasefire deal between West Jerusalem and Hamas

483.summary:
Upwards of 600,000 illegal migrants live in London, accounting for about one in every 12 residents, a study has estimated
Read Full Article at RT.com

484.title: Prof. Schlevogt’s Compass № 10: China’s silky future in a realigned world
484.summary:
China’s future looks increasingly bleak, but it has great countercyclical expansion potential via domestic and international rebalancing
Read Full Article at RT.com

485.summary:
The former US president could technically be excommunicated from the Catholic Church for becoming a Master Mason

486.title: Russia-West reset inevitable – senior Polish MP
486.summary:
The West will mend relations with Russia once the Ukraine conflict ends, Polish MP Krzysztof Bosak has predicted

487.summary:
Slovakia plans to expel foreign operatives accused of plotting a Ukraine-style Maidan coup, Prime Minister Robert Fico has said
Read Full Article at RT.com
487.author: RT

488.title: Trump wants Ukraine ‘off his table’ – Bolton
488.summary:
The new US administration is “bad news” for Kiev, former national security adviser has claimed
Read Full Article at RT.com
488.author: RT

489.title: Fyodor Lukyanov: Here’s what Trump 2.0 means for the US and Russia
489.summary:
The 47th president wants to end conflicts but not resolve them
Read Full Article at RT.com
489.author: RT

490.title: US halts programs for migrants, including Ukrainians – NYT

696.title: ‘The Closure of Meta’s US Fact-Checking Programme Is a Major Setback in the Fight Against Disinformation’
696.summary:
Jan 24 (IPS) - CIVICUS speaks with Olivia Sohr about the challenges of disinformation and the consequences of the closure of Meta’s fact-checking programme in the USA. Olivia is the Director of Impact and New Initiatives at Chequeado, an Argentine civil society organisation working since 2010 to improve the quality of public debate through fact-checking, combating disinformation, promoting access to information and open data.

Read the full story, “‘The Closure of Meta’s US Fact-Checking Programme Is a Major Setback in the Fight Against Disinformation’”, on globalissues.org →

697.title: Report Exposes Silent Global Emergency as More Crises-Affected Children Need Urgent Education Support
697.summary:
NEW YORK & NAIROBI, Jan 24 (IPS) - A report released today on the International Day of Education sounds alarm as the number of school-aged children in crisis worldwide requiring urgent support to access quality education reaches a staggering 234 million—an estimated increase of 35 million over the past three years fueled by intensifying armed conflict, forced displacements, more frequent and severe weather and climatic events, and other crises.

Read the full story, “Report Exposes Silent Global Emergency as More Crises-Affected Children Need Urgent Education Support”, on globalissues.org →

698.title: How Artificial Intelligence Will Affect Asia’s Economies
698.summary:
WASHINGTON DC, Jan 24 (IPS) - Asia-Pacific’s economies are likely to experience labor market shifts because of artificial intelligence (AI), with advanced economies being affected more. About half of all jobs in the region’s advanced economies are exposed to AI, compared to only about a quarter in emerging market and developing economies.

Read the full story, “How Artificial Intelligence Will Affect Asia’s Economies”, on globalissues.org →
